title: Attorney's fees
context: ยง521-35 Attorney&rsquo;s fees. (a) A rental agreement may provide for the payment by the tenant of the costs of a suit, for unpaid rent, and reasonable attorney&rsquo;s fees not in excess of twenty-five per cent of the unpaid rent after default and referral to an attorney not a salaried employee of the landlord or the landlord&rsquo;s assignee. (b) A rental agreement may further provide that reasonable attorney&rsquo;s fees and costs may be awarded to the prevailing party in all other matters arising under this chapter. &copy; A provision in violation of this section is unenforceable.
